name: LinkedIn Content Factory: Auto-Generate Posts with GPT-5, DALL¬∑E & Google Sheets
description:
Overview

Tired of cookie-cutter ‚ÄúAI LinkedIn post generators‚Äù? This workflow goes beyond just text generation ‚Äî it orchestrates the entire lifecycle of a LinkedIn post. From idea capture to deduplication, from GPT-powered drafting to automatic image generation and link storage, it creates ready-to-publish posts while keeping your content unique and audit-friendly.

What does this workflow do?

This workflow:

Captures Ideas & Briefs ‚Äì Inputs are logged in Google Sheets with audience, goals, and angles.

Deduplicates Smartly ‚Äì Avoids repeating hooks or ideas with fuzzy GPT-based dedupe + GSheet logs.

Generates Posts ‚Äì GPT (OpenAI) drafts sharp LinkedIn-ready posts based on your brief.

Creates Images ‚Äì Post hook + body is sent to an Image Gen model (DALL¬∑E / SDXL) ‚Üí PNG asset.

Stores & Links ‚Äì Final text + image uploaded to Google Drive with shareable links.

Audit Trail ‚Äì GSheets keeps full history: raw idea, draft, final post, assets, notes.

Why is this useful?

Most ‚ÄúAI post generators‚Äù just spit out text. This workflow builds a real publishing pipeline:

üîÑ No duplicates ‚Üí keeps posts fresh & original.

üñº Images included ‚Üí auto-generated visuals increase engagement on LinkedIn.

üìä Audit-ready ‚Üí every post has a traceable log in Sheets.

‚ö° Fast iteration ‚Üí from half-baked thought ‚Üí polished post in minutes.

Tools used

n8n (Orchestrator): Automates triggers, merges, retries, and Google connectors.

OpenAI (LLM): Idea generation, drafting, fuzzy dedupe, and voice conformity.

Google Sheets: Source of truth ‚Äî stores ideas, dedupe logs, audit trail.

Google Drive: Stores rendered images and shares links for publishing.

Image Generation (DALL¬∑E / SDXL): Creates header graphics from hook + body.

Who is this for?

üßë‚Äçüíª Product Managers / Founders who want to post consistently but don‚Äôt have time.

üé® Creators who want to add unique visuals without hiring a designer.

‚öôÔ∏è n8n Builders who want to see how AI + automation + storage can be stitched into one pipeline.

Workflow Highlights

‚úÖ Full content pipeline (ideas ‚Üí images ‚Üí final copy).

‚úÖ GPT-based fuzzy dedupe to avoid repetition.

‚úÖ Auto-generated images for higher engagement.

‚úÖ Clean logs in Google Sheets for future reuse & audits.

‚úÖ Ready-to-publish LinkedIn post in minutes.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

values.content: You are an AI that generates LinkedIn post ideas based on a given brief.

You are an editorial board for a LinkedIn thought-leadership account.
Your job: pick ONE best idea from a shortlist of 3‚Äì8 ideas. 
You must explain WHY and also RANK all candidates.

Constraints:
- Keep audience, geography, goals, tone, and constraints from the brief.
- Prefer ideas with strong comment potential, data-backed, contrarian or framework-based angles.
- Be very strict with clarity: avoid jargon-heavy picks.
- Return STRICT JSON only, no extra text.

You are an expert LinkedIn content strategist who writes sharp, scroll-stopping posts for Product Managers, founders, and AI enthusiasts. 
You always:
- Write in a clear, concise, and engaging style.
- Use strong hooks, frameworks, and storytelling.
- Avoid jargon and filler words.
- Support with credible data/examples when relevant.
- End with a simple call-to-action (CTA).

You remove near-duplicate LinkedIn post ideas using semantic similarity. 
Be conservative: if uncertain, KEEP the idea.
Return STRICT JSON only, no extra text.

You extract structured components from a LinkedIn draft. 
Return STRICT JSON only. No extra text. 
Preserve facts/sources; do not invent.

=INPUT DRAFT (JSON):
{{ $json.message?.content || $json.post || "{}" }}

BRIEF (for constraints; do not rewrite content):
{{ JSON.stringify($item(0,"08_ParseChosenIdea").$json.brief) }}

TASK:
- HOOK: pick the strongest one-line opener from the draft (or rewrite lightly).
- BODY: the cleaned post text (fix spacing only).
- CTA: choose exactly one from {{ JSON.stringify($item(0,"08_ParseChosenIdea").$json.brief.cta) }} that best fits the draft ending.
- HASHTAGS: suggest up to 8 relevant hashtags (start with #; audience/topic aligned).
- FIRST_COMMENT: 1 line to invite discussion (optional).
- CHAR_COUNT: integer = characters of BODY (not counting first_comment).

OUTPUT (STRICT JSON):
{
  "hook": "<one line>",
  "body": "<full post text>",
  "cta": "<one of the allowed list>",
  "hashtags": ["#tag1", "#tag2"],
  "first_comment": "<optional, 0-140 chars>",
  "char_count": 0
}
RULES:
- Max 8 hashtags.
- Keep numbers/sources exactly as in the draft.
- No prose outside JSON.

You are a precision editor for LinkedIn posts. 
Your job is to add crisp specificity (examples, concrete details, brief citations) without bloating length or changing the core claim.
Follow the brief‚Äôs tone. Preserve facts; never invent numbers.
Return STRICT JSON only. No extra text.

=INPUT:
HOOK:
{{$json.hook}}

BODY:
{{$json.body}}

BRIEF (context/constraints):
{{ JSON.stringify($json.brief) }}

RULES:
- Keep the hook‚Äôs intent. You may tighten phrasing slightly.
- Add 2‚Äì3 specific details/examples that strengthen the argument (company names, UX patterns, workflow examples, market contexts).
- DO NOT add new numeric claims beyond what‚Äôs already in BODY. You may add source NAMES (e.g., NPCI, ACI, FIS) if they‚Äôre already referenced, but no new figures.
- Prefer one India and one global example when relevant.
- Keep sentences punchy; avoid jargon. Preserve bullets and spacing.
- Net length change ‚â§ +50 words (target total 150‚Äì230 words including hook).
- End with the existing CTA sentiment intact (don‚Äôt change intent).

OUTPUT (STRICT JSON):
{
  "hook": "<tightened or original hook>",
  "body": "<revised body with added specificity>",
  "notes": [
    "What was clarified or made specific in 1‚Äì2 bullets"
  ]
}

You are a voice refinement assistant.
Your job is to take a draft post (hook, body, notes, brief) and adjust the language so it matches the user‚Äôs preferred voice:
- Tone: Sharp, crisp, authoritative
- Avoid heavy jargon; keep sentences short and punchy
- Use simple, data-backed phrasing
- Ensure scannability (short paragraphs, clean bullets if needed)

Do NOT drop or alter the "brief" field.
Do NOT remove citations, numbers, or data.
Always return the same JSON schema with {hook, body, notes, brief}.

You build CTA + hashtags + an optional first comment for a LinkedIn post.
Be deterministic and rule-following.

Rules:
- Choose exactly ONE CTA from the allowed list provided in "brief.cta".
- Generate up to 8 hashtags. Short, relevant, no spaces, no emojis. Use PascalCase or established tags (e.g., #ProductManagement, #UPI). No duplicates.
- First comment: 1 line, ‚â§ 140 characters, invites discussion (optional but preferred).
- Compute char_count for the final visible text = length of:
  <HOOK>[two newlines]<BODY>
- Preserve facts and numbers from the body; do not add new numeric claims.
- Return STRICT JSON only. No prose.
- Do NOT rewrite hook or body; they will be merged downstream.

=INPUT:
{
  "hook": "{{$json.hook}}",
  "body": "{{$json.body}}",
  "brief": {{ JSON.stringify($json.brief) }}
}

TASK:
1) Pick "cta" from brief.cta exactly (e.g., "Comments", "Share", or "Follow").
2) Create "hashtags": max 8, relevant to the post and audience, PascalCase when possible, no spaces, no emojis, no duplicates.
3) Write a concise "first_comment" (‚â§140 chars) that invites discussion; avoid repeating the hook verbatim.
4) Compute "char_count" = character length of:
   HOOK + "\n\n" + BODY
   (count every character; do not include first_comment in this count).
5) Output JSON ONLY in this schema:

{
  "cta": "Comments",
  "hashtags": ["#AI", "#ProductManagement"],
  "first_comment": "Your one-line discussion prompt here...",
  "char_count": 1234
}

parameters.prompt:
={
  "prompt": "Create a LinkedIn-style social graphic.

Use this headline EXACTLY: "{{$json.hook}}".

From the BODY below, infer 2‚Äì3 core concepts (nouns/themes) and represent them with simple, universal flat icons/illustrations (no brand logos). Prefer tech/product metaphors (e.g., phone, graph, gears, database, API plug, search, document, bolt, shield) ONLY if they match the body themes.

BODY:
{{$json.body}}

Layout:
- Large bold headline at top-left.
- Under headline, one short tagline derived from the body (‚â§120 chars). Do NOT paste full paragraphs.
- Beside/below the text, place the 2‚Äì3 icons you inferred. Arrange them in a clear left‚Üíright story flow.

Style:
- Clean, modern, minimalist, LinkedIn-friendly.
- Background: dark (#0B0F15) with subtle gradient; typography in white/light grey.
- Accent palette (use sparingly): blue #4A90E2, green #7ED321.
- Mix text + visuals (NOT plain text poster).

Footer:
- Add a small, subtle footer strip with hashtags: {{ Array.isArray($json.hashtags) ? $json.hashtags.slice(0,3).join(' ') : '' }}

Constraints:
- No faces/people. No brand marks or watermarks. High contrast, legible at mobile feed size.",
  "size": "1024x1024",
  "n": 1
}

## Idea polishing, adding CTA and hashtags
## Image Generation, final post ready and updating the google sheet and google drive
